regions.name: East Coast to Appalachians
regions.theme: Urban decay, dense suburbs, initial chaos
regions.description: Crowded highways, abandoned suburbs, coastal cities in flames. The outbreak is fresh here - bodies everywhere, military checkpoints overrun.

regions.name: Appalachian Mountains
regions.description: Winding mountain roads, isolated cabins, small towns cut off from the world. Fewer infected, but resources are scarce and locals are territorial.

regions.name: Ohio Valley & Rust Belt
regions.theme: Industrial decay, river crossings, abandoned factories
regions.description: Rust belt cities falling apart, rivers to cross, industrial zones full of hazards. Survivor communities are forming, but not all are friendly.

regions.name: Great Plains
regions.description: Flat, open country. You can see for miles - which means they can see you too. Small farming towns, grain silos, and long stretches of nothing.

regions.name: Rocky Mountains
regions.theme: High altitude, harsh weather, treacherous passes
regions.description: Snow-capped peaks, narrow passes, brutal weather. The cold slows the infected, but it'll kill you just as dead. Mountain communities survived better than most.

regions.name: Great Basin & Nevada Desert
regions.theme: Desert wasteland, military installations, extreme heat
regions.description: Scorching desert, abandoned military bases, isolated highway stops. Water is everything. The infected don't last long here, but neither do people without supplies.

regions.name: Northern California
regions.theme: Coastal hills, dense forests, hope on the horizon
regions.description: Green hills, redwood forests, approaching the safe zone. You're so close. But others are heading here too - refugees, raiders, and things worse than infected.
